qas.question: What does a mixed tag team consist of?

answers.text: a male and female on each team

qas.question: When did mixed tag teams start?
What happened when a tag was made?

answers.text: the other team had to automatically switch their legal wrestler as well

qas.question: What isn't uncommon in lucha libre?

context: In the <a1_0>1980s<a1_0/>, mixed tag team matches began to take place, with <a0_0>a male and female on each team<a0_0/> and a rule stating that each wrestler could only attack the opponent of the same gender. If a tag was made, <a2_0>the other team had to automatically switch their legal wrestler as well<a2_0/>. Despite these restrictions, many mixed tag matches do feature some physical interaction between participants of different genders. For example, a heel may take a cheap shot at the female wrestler of the opposing team to draw a negative crowd reaction. In lucha libre, <a3_0>cheap-shots and male-female attacks<a3_0/> are not uncommon.
